results.title: The Hit
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jeremy Thomas and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: In this early Stephen Frears feature, Terence Stamp plays Willie Parker, a philosophising mobster who adopts a tranquil life in Spain after betraying several cohorts. Ten years on they track him down, and two crims, Braddock and Myron, are charged with driving him across Spain en route to Paris where he will be assassinated. The journey is complicated by Willie’s ability to undermine Braddock (a young hot-shot, keen to impress) and Myron (a cool professional). Although tension and violence infuse the set-up, the film is marked by dark humour, and enhanced by Terence Stamp’s wry performance. Cast also includes John Hurt, Tim Roth, and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Pickup on South Street = Pick up on South Street
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Jules Schermer and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Iconic film noir set in New York about a pickpocket who lifts microfilm bearing US secrets from the handbag of the former mistress of a Communist spy. Sam Fuller combines brisk pacing with sizzling dialogue to create a masterful political thriller that plays upon the over-ripe fears of Communism, espionage and political conspiracy. Richard Windmark plays a wonderfully amoral Skip McCoy, a freshly sprung jailbird, trying to play for all best angles, in an increasingly dangerous game he barely comprehends. Also stars the peerless Thelma Ritter as a street-wise grifter and Jean Peters as the louche femme fatale.

results.title: Samsara
results.creator_credit: Pan Nalin, Christoph Friedel, Karl Baumgartner, Fandango, Ocean Films, Pandora Films and Paradis Films
results.brief_description: A young Buddhist returns from three years of meditative solitude, to the monastery where he grew up. As his fellow monks gently reawaken Tashi to the physical world, he simultaneously experiences physical arousal and an interest in women. Despite the efforts of his master to dissuade him, Tashi feels he must encounter the real world in order to renounce it. Hence begins Tashi’s journey of sex, marriage, and industry among a remote mountain community. Set in Ladakh, in the Himalayas, “Samsara” is spectacularly beautiful whilst also successfully conveying the trials of life for this village. Tashi - although enjoying the bliss of sex and pleasure of marriage - is ill-prepared for the conflicts of life as an ordinary man. Christy Chung, playing Tashi’s wife, provides a grounded perspective of what spirituality truly means in everyday life.

results.title: Nine queens = Nueve Reinas
results.creator_credit: Fabian Belinsky, Pablo Bossi and Patagonik Film Group
results.brief_description: Impressive debut from Argentinean filmmaker Fabian Belinsky, sees two con-artists link up, despite their mutual mistrust and misgivings, in order to pull off increasingly complex, daring and lucrative scams. This culminates in a scheme to sell a valuable sheet of stamps, the Nine Queens of the title, to a wealthy businessman. To do this the pair must continuously re-invent the set-up and its execution. Reminiscent of the work of David Mamet, Belinsky keeps the audience delightfully bewildered by the state of play as the narrative threads gradually unravel. An amusing and clever addition to the caper genre.

results.title: Forty guns = 40 guns
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Globe Enterprises and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A classic example of the Western genre, written, directed and produced by maverick Samuel Fuller. Shot in black and white and “cinemascope” this lush film is filled with all you would expect from a Western: guns, fancy horse riding, showdowns and a bit of romance. The tough town femme-fatale Jessica Drummond (Barbara Stanwyck) has a posse of forty hired guns that make her the de facto leader of the County. She falls in love with a Marshall (Barry Sullivan) who arrives to restore law and order with tensions building up to a showdown.

results.title: Cube
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Natali, Betty Orr, Mehra Meh, Cube Libre, Feature Film Project and Trimark Pictures
results.brief_description: First time director Vincenzo Natali’s low budget thriller is a tribute to the ensemble cast performances as well as his direction. The action takes place in what appears to be an experiment in human survival as a select group of people wake up contained within the walls of a cube, twenty-six identical rooms wide and twenty-six high. How they got there is not made clear but finding their way out is the whole premise of the film. The skill-sets of this particular group of people aid or hinder their survival - for example, an old thief works out a way to find out if a room is booby-trapped or not - and survival is at stake because the cube kills and this is shown in scenes of visceral gore. The production design by Jasna Stefanovic, music by Mark Karven and some very believable special effects add to the tense but dreamlike sci-fi mood of the film. Human behaviour under stress provides the viewer with a gripping and edgy personal drama - even though ‘participants’ have been de-humanised by being used like guinea pigs in a maze. Cast includes Nicole DeBoer, Nicky Guardagni, David Hewlett, Andrew Miller, Julian Richings, Wayne Robson and Maurice Dean Wint.

results.title: Hideous kinky
results.creator_credit: Gillies MacKinnon, Ann Scott, BBC Film Unit and Film Consortium
results.brief_description: In an era about ‘love’ and the spiritual quest for the individual, young English mother of two Julia (Kate Winslet) goes on a journey with her two young children to live in Marrakech, Morocco 1972. Based on the novel by Esther Freud (daughter of painter Lucien) and told from the perspective of the youngest daughter, Julia throws herself into the local culture and with barely the means to support her girls with food and shelter. She is match-made by the children to a street performer and dubious local Bilal (Said Taghmaoui) and they soon become a couple. Exotic and enticing, more a visual feast than a dramatic quest, the film may challenge viewers’ notions of parenting, self-fulfilment and ultimately love. Some may just love the exotic travelogue nature that is the background of the Moroccan location. Soundtrack includes some memorable hits from the British charts of the 1960s/70s. The two performers in the roles of the daughters are captivating - eight year old Bea (Bella Riza) and six year old Lucy (Carrie Mullan) who are tired of mum’s adventures and just want to be ‘normal’. Directed by Gillies MacKinnon, with screenplay by his brother Billy MacKinnon.

results.title: A room for Romeo Brass
results.creator_credit: Shane Meadows, Charles Pattinson, George Faber, Alliance Atlantis and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shane Meadows writes and directs this drama about two young boys’ friendship and their coming-of-age. Neighbours, the boys share life experiences (and porno magazines) and support each other as one is physically unwell and the other’s parents have separated. The friendship is tested however when a creepy stranger manipulates his way into their lives by trying to date the attractive older sister of Romeo. Tensions arise as the stranger becomes more violent as his affections are rejected. Touching, funny and disturbing, this feature stars Paddy Considine as the stranger, with wonderful performances by the two young leads Andrew Shim and Ben Marshall. Bob Hoskins makes an appearance as a visiting teacher. Soundtrack features music by Beck, Beth Orton and Billy Bragg.

results.title: The Story of the weeping camel = Die Geschichte vom weinenden kamel
results.creator_credit: Byambasuren Davaa, Luigi Falorni, Tobias Siebert, Film Munchen and Hochschule fur Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Set in the Gobi Desert, Southern Mongolia, this narrative-style documentary explains a wonderful custom that could be used as an allegory for motherhood in the modern world. Made by two student filmmakers, they travel to Mongolia to meet a family of three generations living a simple nomadic lifestyle. During the spring, one of the family’s camels has a difficult delivery, giving birth to a rare white colt but she then rejects the youngster. Two family members set off to fetch a musician who plays a violin-like stringed instrument. The musician and a female family member perform a simple ritual that will re-unite the mother camel with her young. Striking landscape vistas and moving insight into the nomadic family life are captured by Luigi Falorni’s cinematography in this poignant representation of folklore and traditional storytelling. Nominated in the 2004 Academy Awards for Best Documentary (feature length).

results.title: Casa de los babys
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Alejandro Springall, Lemore Syvan, Blue Magic Pictures, Springall Pictures and Syvan
results.brief_description:
Low key effort from esteemed director John Sayles, who in this ensemble drama, explores the issues of adoption of South American babies by Northern American women. The story centres around six women who are impatiently passing time, awaiting a child to take home with them. Each character, filled with anticipation (and some with fear), discusses their new role as mother, reflecting upon their pasts, revealing key moments that lead them to this point. Sayles also devotes some narrative time to the story of a young impoverished boy and his depressing milieu, a pregnant teenager and her overbearing mother, a cleaning woman raising her siblings and a hotel manager and her errant son. Multiple story threads dilutes the emotional impact, but fine acting and some sticky social issues provide the film with occasional potency.
Cast includes: Daryl Hannah, Lili Taylor, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Mary Steenburgen
